item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I don't want to go to heaven. None of my friends are there." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by W.B. Yeats
item.description: "What can be explained is not poetry." -- W.B. Yeats

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "In dreams begin responsibilities." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description:
"Do you hate people?
I don't hate them...I just feel better when they're not around." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "being alone never felt right. sometimes it felt good, but it never felt right." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "There are no facts, only interpretations." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Faith: not wanting to know what the truth is." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Is man merely a mistake of God's? Or God merely a mistake of man?" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I am one thing, my writings are another." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The author must keep his mouth shut when his work starts to speak." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "I am free and that is why I am lost." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Paths are made by walking" -- Franz Kafka

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Between the idea And the reality Between the motion And the act Falls the Shadow" -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Rainer Marie Rilke
item.description: "Let life happen to you. Believe me: life is in the right, always." -- Rainer Marie Rilke

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "How do I know what I think until I see what I say?" -- E.M. Forster

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Nothing strengthens authority so much as silence." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "All war is a symptom of man's failure as a thinking animal." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time." -- Mark Twain

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Sean Mangan
item.description: "Life is too short when you think of the length of death" -- Sean Mangan

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "After all, what's a life, anyway? We're born, we live a little while, we die." -- E.B. White

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Franklin Delano Roosevelt
item.description: "The Truth is found when men (and Women) are free to pursue it." -- Franklin Delano Roosevelt

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by A. Philip Randolph
item.description: "Freedom is never given; it is won." -- A. Philip Randolph

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Each man lives for himself, uses his freedom to achieve his personal goals, and feels with his whole being that right now he can or cannot do such-and-such an action; but as soon as he does it, this action, committed at a certain moment in time, becomes irreversible, and makes itself the property of history, in which is has not a free but a predestined significance. " -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The Revolution introduced me to art, and in turn, art introduced me to the Revolution!" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "He who has overcome his fears will truly be free." -- Aristotle

item.title: ZeYnAb add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Happiness depends upon ourselves." -- Aristotle
